main event: Unidentified flying object spotted near Randolph Air Force Base in Texas on multiple occasions in 1959 and 1960.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright, glowing, white in color, and moving at high speeds with abrupt changes in direction.
The objects were observed both visually by personnel on the ground and on radar at the base.
On one occasion, the object was reported to be oscillating vertically at a high rate of speed for about 1.5 minutes before disappearing.
Another sighting described the object as small, orange/reddish-white in color, with a tail that appeared to be a turbine, and exhibiting erratic flight patterns.
Weather conditions during the sightings included rain, clouds, and low visibility, but did not seem to impede the visibility or radar detection of the objects.
witnesses: Ground personnel, airborne personnel, and radar operators
